subject: Marketing
title: Belonging and Identity
description: A short lesson to help you apply Belonging and Identity.

hook.text: Harley-Davidson doesn't sell motorcycles. It sells membership in a tribe.

buildup.text: People buy products that signal who they areâ€”or who they want to become.

discovery.text: Identity marketing taps our deep need to belong and be recognized by a group.

twist.text: The product becomes secondary. Community and symbols become the real value.

climax.text: Apple, Nike, and Patagonia sell identity first. The product is the membership card.

punchline.text: People don't buy products. They buy belonging.

quiz.question: What does Harley-Davidson primarily sell according to identity marketing?
options: Membership in a tribe and sense of belonging
The fastest and most powerful motorcycles
